PUBLIC "-//David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library//TEXT (US::NDD::::Robert Edward Dawson Papers)//EN"
"dawsonrobertedward.xml" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.xsl (sy2003-10-15).

Also, the top level of the finding aid (above the dsc) changed to conform to current Rubenstein Library and NC EAD standards as laid out in the Inventory Style Guide and in the NCEAD Best Practice Guidelines. Within the dsc, dates for series were normalized. These changes were made by Michelle Belden.
Also, container TYPE and LABEL attribute values were standardized according to the Rubenstein Library EAD 2002 manual and the NCEAD eadlocal.ent by Ruth E. Bryan.
The tag list inside index was changed to indexentry by Ruth E. Bryan.

Addition 2001-0153 made to electronic finding aid. Materialsreceived as a gift, 2001. Minimally processed by Ann G. Langford on November13, 2001. Encoded by Ann G. Langford on November 13, 2001. Date span notchanged. Linear feet changed from 33.5 to 46.1. Item count changed from 20,410to 25,113.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location ofthese materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Robert Edward Dawson Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Robert Edward Dawson Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift, 2000-2001.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Ann Langford; Shayla C. Nunnally; Kate Crassons; RuthE. Bryan
Completed June 5, 2000, January 23, 2001, and April 26, 2001
Additions minimally processed by Ann G. Langford
Last updated December 19, 2001
Encoded by Ruth E. Bryan; Ann G. Langford
This collection is unprocessed: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: African-American ophthalmologist and citizen of Durham (Durham Co.), N.C. Born on February 23,1918 in Rocky Mount, N.C., Dawson received his B.S. from Clark College inAtlanta, Ga., and his M.D. from Meharry Medical College in Nashville, Tenn.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: This collection documents Dawson's professional and civic life.Materials include scrapbooks; reports; subject files; memoranda; andcorrespondence, in particular from prominent Durhamites, such as Floyd B.McKissick, Sr., and James E. Shepard. The collection details Dawson's medicalpractices, teaching, and board memberships at Lincoln Community Health Center, Lincoln Hospital, and Durham County General Hospital. It also documentshis lengthy and high-level involvement with the following institutions andorganizations: Meharry Medical College, George W. Hubbard Hospital, the National Medical Society, the National Society for the Prevention of Blindness,the North Carolina Society for the Prevention ofBlindness, the Old North State Medical Society, North Carolina Central University, and the Mutual Savings & Loan Association. Thecollection also contains 35 color photographs and 48 negatives. Acquired aspart of the John Hope Franklin Research Center for African and African AmericanDocumentation. (1939-1998) (11,550 items) (19.00 lf) (acc#00-320)

The addition to the collection contains financial materials,correspondence, memoranda, newspaper clippings and magazine articles (8560items, 1946-1997), and photographs (300 items) that continue to documentDawson's medical career and his involvement in organizations in Durham, NorthCarolina, and nationally. In addition to the institutions, hospitals, medicalpractices, and civic groups that have been described in the first accession,this addition includes materials from Dawson's real estate ventures. Theseinclude owning apartments with the firms Dawson and Watts and then Dawson, Watts and Cleland (1970s) and buildingapartments with the firm Century Oaks, Ltd. (1977-1981). The majority ofthe 2 black-and-white and 297 color photographs appear to be of family. Onetintype is included of an unidentified woman wearing what may be a weddingdress (undated). (8860 items) (14.50 lf) (2001-73)

The addition to the collection (4703 items, dated 1946-1996 and n. d.,bulk date 1998-1994, 12.60 linear feet) includes subject files holding reports,memoranda, correspondence, and printed material, as well as many business andpersonal financial records. In addition, there are two color photographs.(01-153)

accessible, because they require further processing before use. Please contact
Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

Attention: Collection needs further processing before use.
Reformat newsprint and coated fax paper in boxes 8-14; remove materials in
envelopes and rusty fasteners throughout; resleeve photographs in boxes 3, 8,
and 11; be aware of sensitive material in boxes 1, 9 and 14 (student grades)
and personal medical and financial information (throughout). Contact Technical
Services.

accessrestrict.p:
Attention: Collection is restricted. Patrons must sign a release
form regarding privacy rights. Contact Technical Services.
